div.bibl: Svenska Amerikanaren, Jan. 7, 1909OSTERGREN RECEIVES FIRST PRIZE

body.p: Through the Chicago Architectural Club, the Portland Cement Company offered a prize to the architect in Chicago who planned the best $8000 house constructed of cement. The prizes were as follows: First: $200; second: $75; and third: $25. These awards were given out December 21 to the best architects in Chicago. The first prize was awarded to Robert Ostergren, a young man from Stockholm.

He now lives with his brother-in-law at 2939 Vernon Avenue, and works for Spencer & Powers as an architect. He has only been in this country eight years. Last year, he graduated from Armour Institute with high honors. Young Ostergren is very self-determined. It is said he tried to help someone else to get the second prize,
and would have succeeded, if it had not been noticed that Ostregren's hand had been in on the play. We wish him all the success possible in his work.
